qas.question: What is the term for something that lists the important and notable parts of a genome?
Which group was created to generate a genome map of human genetic material?
Whose genome map greatly aided the Human Genome Project?
Where did Weissenbach and his colleagues work?

plausible_answers.text: every DNA base in a genome

qas.question: What does a genome map list the order of?
What does a genome sequence identify?
What is a Genoscope less detailed than?

plausible_answers.text: aids in navigating around the genome

qas.question: What does a Genoscope help a scientist do?

plausible_answers.text: to map and to sequence the human genome

context: Whereas a genome sequence lists the order of <b4_0>every DNA base in a genome<b4_0/>, a <a0_0>genome map<a0_0/> identifies <b5_0>the landmarks<b5_0/>. A genome map is less detailed than <b6_0>a genome sequence<b6_0/> and <b7_0>aids in navigating around the genome<b7_0/>. <a1_0>The Human Genome Project<a1_0/> was organized <b8_0>to map and to sequence the human genome<b8_0/>. A fundamental step in the project was the release of a detailed genomic map by <a2_0>Jean Weissenbach<a2_0/> and his team at the <a3_0>Genoscope<a3_0/> in Paris.
